strategic_overview.purpose: Enable employees to request company-approved devices (notebooks and phones) through a self-service Power App, triggering approval workflows and integrating with internal policies.

mvp_components.app_details: Allows employees to browse available devices, view specs, photos, availability, and filter by department-approved models. Form for employees to select a device, justify business need, select urgency level, and auto-populate employee name/department from Azure AD.

app_screens.screen_details: Screen to browse and filter available devices.
Screen to view device specs, photos, and availability.

features.feat_0008: Integration with Device Catalog Data Source
features.feat_0012: User Interface Consistency with Parent App

app_screens.screen_details: Form to submit a new device order request.
Screen to confirm the order before submission.

features.feat_0020: Conditional Visibility of Fields based on User Role

mvp_components.flow_details: Workflow for managers to receive approval notifications and approve/reject with comments within an SLA of 2 business days.

flow_actions.action_details: Manager receives a notification for a new approval request.
Manager approves or rejects the request with comments.

post_mvp_modules.details: Allows employees to view the status of their requests and receive email notifications at each step. An optional Power BI dashboard for tracking could be added.
post_mvp_modules.recommendation: Extend the Order Request Form with additional screens for status tracking to provide transparency and improve user experience.

post_mvp_modules.details: Enables IT Administrators to update stock levels, mark orders as fulfilled, and link to the procurement system.
post_mvp_modules.recommendation: Extend the Device Catalog app with additional screens for inventory management to streamline the fulfillment process and maintain accurate stock levels.

constraints: Must use Power Apps Canvas App
Data must be stored in Dataverse
Approval process must use Power Automate
Device models filtered by department policy
App must support desktop + mobile usage
No external users (internal only via Azure AD)
integration_points: Power Automate for approvals and notifications
strategic_overview.notes: The design should be clean and corporate with responsive layout for phone and desktop, using dropdowns, cards, and status icons. Confirm order screen before submission and ensure accessible design (WCAG AA).

fields.name: Role
fields.description: Role of the employee within the company

fields.name: DeviceType
fields.description: Type of the device (notebook or phone)

fields.name: EmployeeID
fields.description: ID of the employee who placed the order

database_model.notes: The 'Employees' table is related to the 'Orders' table through the 'EmployeeID' foreign key. Similarly, the 'Devices' table is related to the 'Orders' table through the 'DeviceID' foreign key. This normalization choice allows us to reduce data redundancy and improve data integrity.
